'''Orgulas Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[Buckland]].

==History==
Orgulas was the youngest son of [[Marmadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Adaldrida Bolger]]. He had one son, [[Gorbulas Brandybuck|Gorbulas]].<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Orgulas'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

[[Jim Allan]] noted that the adjective ''orgulous'' ("proud", "haughty"), an anglisized form of a French word corresponding to ''orgeilleux in Modern French, is used by Malory in ''Le Morte Darthur''. There it is used as a title of a Knight of the Round Table named Bellyance ''le Orgulus''.<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 204</ref>
